name: Claude Plus V1

stages.name: Proof Validation
stages.description: Final quality assurance and proof verification

userContext: Look at desktop-mode.html in C:\github\ai-assistant\www and work on a responsive layout that will always fit on mobile devices. It currently can sometimes overflow to the bottom depending on the content in the chat or the phone resolution when viewing the page. Do not break my styling please. This is a mobile pass layout fit optimization thank you.

results.planning:
UNDERSTANDING: User wants to fix mobile responsive layout issues in desktop-mode.html where content sometimes overflows beyond the viewport depending on chat content and phone resolution, while preserving existing styling.

APPROACH: Analyze the current HTML/CSS structure, identify overflow causes, and implement mobile-first responsive design fixes using CSS viewport units, flexbox/grid optimizations, and proper scrolling containers.

STEPS: 
1) Read /mnt/c/github/ai-assistant/www/src/desktop-mode.html to understand current structure
2) Use Grep to find CSS files and examine styling patterns with pattern "\.css$"
3) Analyze viewport meta tags, container heights, and flex/grid layouts
4) Identify overflow triggers (chat messages, input areas, image content)
5) Test current layout behavior by examining CSS for fixed heights, absolute positioning
6) Create responsive fixes using CSS clamp(), vh/vw units, overflow handling
7) Implement proper scrolling containers for chat areas
8) Add media queries for various mobile breakpoints if needed
9) Preserve existing design aesthetic while fixing overflow issues

TEST_CONSIDERATIONS: Will address scenarios like long chat histories, large images in messages, different phone screen sizes (small phones ~320px to large phones ~428px), landscape/portrait orientations, virtual keyboard appearance, and content that exceeds viewport height.

EVIDENCE: Will show before/after CSS comparisons, demonstrate how overflow containers are structured, provide specific CSS rules that handle viewport constraints, and show how existing styling is preserved while fixing mobile issues.

CONFIDENCE: Medium - Responsive layout fixes require careful analysis of existing CSS architecture and testing across multiple viewport scenarios without breaking current design patterns.
